page.title: 02LEISURE & RECREATION:L'BORO
page.content: Our D.Block has been associated with recreation for many centuries. Much of the land was once used for royal hunting parks. There are still boundary ditches and tree lines that show us where the parks were. The results of a survey that we carried out using people living in our D.Block show that the majority of people spent the majority of their leisure time either at home or using the leisure facilities in Loughborough or Leicester. The main leisure activities at home include using home computers, watching television (from a few hours a week to six hours a day), gardening, reading, craft work. Other leisure activities include, sports, music, visiting friends and relatives, visiting the local pub and cinema, eating out.
